title.narrative: Regional Independent Media Support Programme in Nicaragua

description.narrative: In Central America the independent media faces many structural barriers that prevent it from playing a more effective role in promoting democracy and freedom of expression. These include deficient media laws and regulations weak judiciaries state control o f the media oligarchic ownership structures and limited advertising revenues.There is no vibrant civil society organizations that support and work with independent media. However democratic political culture requires a strong civil-society sector and an in dependent media to ensure that citizens are well informed about the actions of government institutions and that right holders have the means to freely influence public policies enabling democratic political transitions that empower all citizens including v ulnerable populations.The project provides competence skills to independent media in Nicaragua and Central America to manage their business efficiently and to work innovative ways with investigative journalism methods. To achieve self-sustainability traini ng in marketing techniques and effective management strategic planning and other basic tools is required. Project supports also the Communication Unit of Centro Humboldt to strengthen institutional capacity and sustainability of the important NGO that work on environmental and policy issues in national and local level.The defence of human rights is one of the primary tasks of journalism and journalists cannot do their work if their own human rights are violated. VIKES trainings will involve new technologies and expand the possibilities of access to new media: democratize the right to inform and be informed and promote the journalism from the perspective of human rights.Vikes is in Nicaragua since 2007 and has improved the professional skills for more than 10 0 journalists and students in Nicaragua. Journalists have produced radio/TV -reportages on environmental issues with the important assistance of the partner C.Humboldt. The principal beneficiaries are partner organizations ONDA LOCAL and C. HUMBOLDT (Nicar agua) and EL FARO (El Salvador) ELPASOSDELANIMALGRANDE (Honduras) and independent journalists and cooperatives.
